game_description: Get in flow, unlock new creatures, and dive into the world of Skybinder. Skybinder is a minimalist VR puzzle game. * Connect dots to solve increasingly detailed 3D puzzles * Create an enormous whale and a cheeky chicken, triangle by triangle * Discover which dots among dozens connect to reveal a king cobra Activate your mind in this meditative game that soothes and stimulates. Skybinder is a puzzle anyone can play, but few can master. Can you become the Skybinder?
Languages: English, English (UK), English (US), English (Australia), English (Canada), English (South Africa)
review_1: I love this game! I am always looking for relaxing games on Quest and they're so hard to find. From the moment I opened up SkyBinder, I was taken to a zen place. The puzzles are challenging and fun, and the audio is *chef's kiss*. Can't wait to recommend this to my friends.
review_2: This experience is something that is built for (literally but also figuratively) for the VR medium. After a quick and intuitive training, the player can easily stretch and rotate the world around them with a remarkable natural ease. This allows the immersion to really set in so that the music and the challenging puzzles come into focus. I really love this and could spend a lot of time in the experience, pushing myself cognitively while really vibing out!
review_3: After few levels it is start to be bit boring.
review_4: This game is beyond description, utterly amazing, it's like someone took the concept of connect the dot style art AND tangrams, which I love, and made them 3D. Crazy fun and relaxing while also challenging your skill in spatial realtions. I saw it on a Oculus Facebook group and asked to be told when it was released as it looked amazing. Well whoever it was I asked promptly told me when it released and I bought it day one. I love supporting developers whenever possible, IF I like or believe in what they are doing and this game is beyond amazing and worth every penny.
review_5: I absolutely love this puzzle game. The concept of connecting the dots to make an origami-like creature is simple but the sound design and the way you can scale and rotate your model make for a richly immersive and pleasant experience. The sound and animation make you feel particularly euphoric when you complete a puzzle figure and you just want to keep connecting more dots!
